data.name: Breeze around Dam Flask or beyond...lets see where the fancy takes us!
data.description: Please meet us in the car park by the bike park shelter at least ten minutes prior to the ride start time, where we will do some basic safety checks before heading out up Loxley Road towards Dam Flask.  Here we have a choice for you, either riding around this beautiful dam before stopping off at the Flask End cafe for a warm drink (and just maybe a piece of their delicious home made cake too) and a chat, or heading a little further afield up to the Strines Inn, along Mortimer Road and then taking one of the right turns back to Bradfield if the fancy takes us...we can decide on the day as a group...before heading back towards Malin Bridge along Loxley Road again.  We hope you can join us but of course as with any winter ride we will keep a close eye on the weather, and our fingers crossed for a dry and mild day.

data.name: Come fly with me!
data.description: This ride includes a combination of off road trails, busy roads and canal towpath, and since introduced has become a popular one! We'll set off from Leigh towards Astley where we'll cross the moss towards Irlam. From here we'll continue to the City Airport (formerly Barton Aerodrome) where we'll have our stop at Runway 26. We can watch the aircraft as we have our drinks and refreshments and a chat. We'll then continue towards Worsley and return to Leigh. Please bring a spare inner tube or puncture repair kit and dress to suit the weather conditions (quite often 4 seasons in one day!) Please bring money to buy drinks/snacks or provide your own. We always ride at a social pace to suit the whole group,we have lots of stops along the way and nobody gets left behind. We are a friendly group and welcome newcomers to our rides. Any questions email Joy or Margaret at breezenetworklancashire@gmail.com or see our Facebook page facebook.com/breezlancs

data.description: Need to get back on your bike after the excesses of the festive season? Come and join me on a gentle 15-mile ride around the country lanes. Ideally you should bring water to drink during the ride and have a spare inner tube and pump with you. Please arrive 10 minutes before the start time so that we can do our bike safety checks and go through the route - thank you

Watford based cycling group aiming to post a ride every two weeks starting in Feb 2018. 
Usually our start point will be the Essex Arms in Cassiobury, Watford.
The aim of our rides over the next 6 months will be to increase pace from an average of 14mph and beyond and include at least 2 decent climbs within the ride over a 30-40 mile distance.
We welcome new members. 

John & Simon

data.name: Sunlight Women's Club Rides
data.description: Come and join our friendly Saturday morning Women's Club Rides!We are a friendly group of women who are keen to invite more women to come along and join our great club "The Port Sunlight Wheelers". We are delighted with the addition of Women Only rides to our club and the increase in female riders it is bringing. You do not initially have to be a club member to join us...come along for a few rides to see if you like it first! Our rides offer a fun and supportive way for women who want to ride at club level without the anxieties and pressures that sometimes women can feel at the thought of riding with a male dominated club ride. You can choose to stay with the Women's Rides, or use it as a stepping stone to the traditional Sunday Club Rides or indeed dip in and out of both, it's a good alternative if you can't make a Sunday. The wider club offers lots of opportunities and a wealth of knowledge for those who wish to try out time-trial or cyclo-cross, as well as the annual club cycling weekend away, trips abroad or social events and of course access to our lovely club kit! There are also events for children of members (The Women's rides are for adult women over 16 years old).The Women's Club Rides will take you into rolling Cheshire or the Welsh hills and are around 40-50 miles long at about 14-15mph average speed, depending on terrain and conditions. Whilst you would be expected to be of a certain capability we will not leave anyone behind and always wait on hills. Also we do not usually have a cafe stop so make sure you bring enough fluids and fuel to sustain you. The map shown is typical example of one of our rides.We meet fortnightly at Eureka Cycle Café (The Mills) at about 9am for a cuppa and a chat before leaving at 9.30am. Please park (free) in the Tudor Rose car park on the other side of the crossroads. If you don't want a cuppa first just meet outside the cafe at 9.30am.My contact details are below...let me know you are coming so I can look out for you ;)Alternatively we are currently running slightly shorter, easier paced fortnightly rides "Sunlight Women's Easy Rider!" from Nets Cafe, Burton (on alternate fortnight to the club ride) also on this web site. These are for women who are already riding regularly but wish to gain experience of group riding including speed and endurance. They aim to join the regular Women's Club Run by late spring 2018. The "easy rider" will then become a Women's Club Ride as above hopefully with enough women to run weekly. There is no expectation that you should join the club until you are riding on the longer Women's Club Ride.**INFORMATION** For all rides please make sure you fit the minimum fitness requirements and are riding a road bike (drop handlebars) with clipped in pedals. Please see FAQ on Sunlight Women's Rides Group for appropriate equipment, clothing, nutrition etc.We look forward to welcoming you!Best Wishes Nicky Please note none of our rides are suitable for novice/occasional/leisure riders, hybrid bikes or for flat pedals. Riders could instead look at Breeze rides on this website or Wirral Belles (google) .If you need more info or to check if our rides are for you then please send me a message:on this website send me a buddy request and I will message youfacebook @sunlightwomenscyclingemail velospeed123@gmail.com
data.beta:formattedDescription:
Come and join our friendly Saturday morning Women's Club Rides!
We are a friendly group of women who are keen to invite more women to come along and join our great club "The Port Sunlight Wheelers". We are delighted with the addition of Women Only rides to our club and the increase in female riders it is bringing. You do not initially have to be a club member to join us...come along for a few rides to see if you like it first!
Our rides offer a fun and supportive way for women who want to ride at club level without the anxieties and pressures that sometimes women can feel at the thought of riding with a male dominated club ride. You can choose to stay with the Women's Rides, or use it as a stepping stone to the traditional Sunday Club Rides or indeed dip in and out of both, it's a good alternative if you can't make a Sunday. The wider club offers lots of opportunities and a wealth of knowledge for those who wish to try out time-trial or cyclo-cross, as well as the annual club cycling weekend away, trips abroad or social events and of course access to our lovely club kit! There are also events for children of members (The Women's rides are for adult women over 16 years old).

The Women's Club Rides will take you into rolling Cheshire or the Welsh hills and are around 40-50 miles long at about 14-15mph average speed, depending on terrain and conditions. Whilst you would be expected to be of a certain capability we will not leave anyone behind and always wait on hills. Also we do not usually have a cafe stop so make sure you bring enough fluids and fuel to sustain you. The map shown is typical example of one of our rides.
We meet fortnightly at Eureka Cycle Café (The Mills) at about 9am for a cuppa and a chat before leaving at 9.30am. Please park (free) in the Tudor Rose car park on the other side of the crossroads. If you don't want a cuppa first just meet outside the cafe at 9.30am.
My contact details are below...let me know you are coming so I can look out for you ;)

Alternatively we are currently running slightly shorter, easier paced fortnightly rides "Sunlight Women's Easy Rider!" from Nets Cafe, Burton (on alternate fortnight to the club ride) also on this web site. These are for women who are already riding regularly but wish to gain experience of group riding including speed and endurance. They aim to join the regular Women's Club Run by late spring 2018. The "easy rider" will then become a Women's Club Ride as above hopefully with enough women to run weekly. There is no expectation that you should join the club until you are riding on the longer Women's Club Ride.

**INFORMATION** For all rides please make sure you fit the minimum fitness requirements and are riding a road bike (drop handlebars) with clipped in pedals. Please see FAQ on Sunlight Women's Rides Group for appropriate equipment, clothing, nutrition etc.

We look forward to welcoming you!
Best Wishes Nicky

Please note none of our rides are suitable for novice/occasional/leisure riders, hybrid bikes or for flat pedals. Riders could instead look at Breeze rides on this website or Wirral Belles (google) .
If you need more info or to check if our rides are for you then please send me a message:
on this website send me a buddy request and I will message you
facebook @sunlightwomenscycling
email velospeed123@gmail.com

organizer.name: Sunlight Women's Rides
organizer.description:
Come and join our friendly Saturday morning Women's Club Rides!
We are a friendly group of women who are keen to invite more women to come along and join our great club "The Port Sunlight Wheelers". We are delighted with the addition of Women Only rides to our club and the increase in female riders it is bringing. You do not initially have to be a club member to join us...come along for a few rides to see if you like it first! 
Our rides offer a fun and supportive way for women who want to ride at club level without the anxieties and pressures that sometimes women can feel at the thought of riding with a male dominated club ride. You can choose to stay with the Women's Rides, or use it as a stepping stone up to the traditional Sunday Club Rides or indeed dip in and out of both, it's a good alternative if you can't make a Sunday. The wider club offers lots of opportunities and a wealth of knowledge for those who wish to try out time-trial, road racing or cyclo-cross, as well as the annual club cycling weekend away, trips abroad or social events and of course access to our lovely club kit! There are also events for children of members (The Women's rides/Club rides however are for adults over 16 years old).
We have two Sunlight Women's Club Rides both running fortnightly on opposite weeks:
1/ "Women's club ride" Our faster paced, often hillier ride will take you into rolling Cheshire or the Welsh hills and is around 40-50 miles long at about 14-15mph average speed, depending on terrain and conditions. Whilst you would be expected to be of a a good level of cycling fitness and capable of keeping up with the pace we aim not to leave anyone behind and always regroup at the top of hills.(Sometimes riders come with a backup plan to turn off early if they are unsure if they can complete the full ride at the required pace). We ask that new riders to the group first do a 'steady ride' as below.
2/ "Women's steady club ride" Our popular, slightly shorter, steadier paced ride has developed from women who where keen to gain experience of group riding and increase their distance, speed and endurance. It is about 40 miles in length at 13-14 mph average speed and will take you into the flatter parts of Cheshire and the Welsh border.
For both rides we do not usually have a cafe stop so make sure you bring enough fluids and fuel to sustain you!
We look forward to welcoming you!
Best Wishes Nicky 
**INFORMATION** For all rides please make sure you fit the minimum fitness requirements and are riding a road bike (drop handlebars) with clipped in pedals. Please see FAQ below.
Please note none of our rides are suitable for novice/occasional/leisure riders, hybrid bikes or for flat pedals. Riders could instead look at Breeze rides on this website or Wirral Belles (google) .
Dates for all rides can be found at https://www.letsride.co.uk/groups/s...  
 
If you need more info or to check if our rides are for you then please send me a message:
facebook @sunlightwomenscycling
email velospeed123@gmail.com
Or look at our club website The Port Sunlight Wheelers  http://portsunlightwheelers.co.uk/

FAQ                        
How fit do I need to be? 
Longer Women's Club Ride: New riders should be confident that they can ride 40 miles at 14-15mph average speed. Nobody is usually left behind and we always wait on hills (although obviously a certain level of fitness is expected). All riders should come on our steady ride first!
Short ride: New riders should be reasonably confident they can ride 30 miles at 13-14mph average speed and should have a desire to continue build their fitness through regular riding. Please message me if you are unsure.       
NB Although these rides are easier paced than our longer ride they are not suitable for novice riders who should instead look at Breeze rides.                  

What equipment do I need?
A roadworthy road bike (with narrow tyres, drop handlebars and clip in pedals)
A pump, spare innertube and tyre levers and be able to use them! There are some great Utube videos to help if you need a practice.
A multi tool is useful too.
What about appropriate clothing/bags?: Riders can carry a saddle bag with tools etc and use a jersey with back pockets to carry food, raincoat etc. Bags, backpacks or panniers are not required. Clothing should be close fitting Lycra. The aim is to be as light and aerodynamic as possible. Loose clothes and extra bags will hinder your progress and can be dangerous while riding in a group!
Change for cafe (or taxi/train home in case of total bike breakdown - hopefully never needed!)
Mobile phone. 
Most riders want to use some sort of cycle computer or smart-phone app to log their rides with speed, average speed, distance etc. They also provide a useful means to measure your improvements.
Enough fluids/energy drink/gels/food etc as required to sustain you through the ride. 
Helmets are not compulsory but advised. Lycra however is!                                  

Do I have to be a member of Port Sunlight Wheelers?
Riders do not have to be a member to come along and ride with us to start, however if you ride regularly with us then membership would be an expectation. There is a once yearly fee of currently £20 that enables you access all the activities and experience the club has to offer, not to mention our lovely kit!

Liability and Insurance: 
While the organisers of the ride will do all in their reasonable control to make the ride as safe as possible, all riders take part at their own risk. It is highly recommended that all riders have some form of insurance (at least 3rd party liability) Please see terms and conditions at the foot of the page.

You do not initially have to be a club member to join us...come along for a few rides to see if you like it first! 
Our rides offer a fun and supportive way for women who want to ride at club level without the anxieties and pressures that sometimes women can feel at the thought of riding with a male dominated club ride. You can choose to stay with the Women's Rides, or use it as a stepping stone up to the traditional Sunday Club Rides or indeed dip in and out of both, it's a good alternative if you can't make a Sunday. The wider club offers lots of opportunities and a wealth of knowledge for those who wish to try out time-trial, road racing or cyclo-cross, as well as the annual club cycling weekend away, trips abroad or social events and of course access to our lovely club kit! There are also events for children of members (The Women's rides/Club rides however are for adults over 16 years old).
We have two Sunlight Women's Club Rides both running fortnightly on opposite weeks:
1/ "Women's club ride" Our faster paced, often hillier ride will take you into rolling Cheshire or the Welsh hills and is around 40-50 miles long at about 14-15mph average speed, depending on terrain and conditions. Whilst you would be expected to be of a a good level of cycling fitness and capable of keeping up with the pace we aim not to leave anyone behind and always regroup at the top of hills.(Sometimes riders come with a backup plan to turn off early if they are unsure if they can complete the full ride at the required pace). We ask that new riders to the group first do a 'steady ride' as below.
2/ "Women's steady club ride" Our popular, slightly shorter, steadier paced ride has developed from women who where keen to gain experience of group riding and increase their distance, speed and endurance. It is about 40 miles in length at 13-14 mph average speed and will take you into the flatter parts of Cheshire and the Welsh border.
For both rides we do not usually have a cafe stop so make sure you bring enough fluids and fuel to sustain you!
We look forward to welcoming you!
Best Wishes Nicky 
**INFORMATION** For all rides please make sure you fit the minimum fitness requirements and are riding a road bike (drop handlebars) with clipped in pedals. Please see FAQ below.
Please note none of our rides are suitable for novice/occasional/leisure riders, hybrid bikes or for flat pedals. Riders could instead look at Breeze rides on this website or Wirral Belles (google) .
Dates for all rides can be found at https://www.letsride.co.uk/groups/s...  
 
If you need more info or to check if our rides are for you then please send me a message:
facebook @sunlightwomenscycling
email velospeed123@gmail.com
Or look at our club website The Port Sunlight Wheelers  http://portsunlightwheelers.co.uk/

FAQ                        
How fit do I need to be? 
Longer Women's Club Ride: New riders should be confident that they can ride 40 miles at 14-15mph average speed. Nobody is usually left behind and we always wait on hills (although obviously a certain level of fitness is expected). All riders should come on our steady ride first!
Short ride: New riders should be reasonably confident they can ride 30 miles at 13-14mph average speed and should have a desire to continue build their fitness through regular riding. Please message me if you are unsure.       
NB Although these rides are easier paced than our longer ride they are not suitable for novice riders who should instead look at Breeze rides.                  

What equipment do I need?
A roadworthy road bike (with narrow tyres, drop handlebars and clip in pedals)
A pump, spare innertube and tyre levers and be able to use them! There are some great Utube videos to help if you need a practice.
A multi tool is useful too.
What about appropriate clothing/bags?: Riders can carry a saddle bag with tools etc and use a jersey with back pockets to carry food, raincoat etc. Bags, backpacks or panniers are not required. Clothing should be close fitting Lycra. The aim is to be as light and aerodynamic as possible. Loose clothes and extra bags will hinder your progress and can be dangerous while riding in a group!
Change for cafe (or taxi/train home in case of total bike breakdown - hopefully never needed!)
Mobile phone. 
Most riders want to use some sort of cycle computer or smart-phone app to log their rides with speed, average speed, distance etc. They also provide a useful means to measure your improvements.
Enough fluids/energy drink/gels/food etc as required to sustain you through the ride. 
Helmets are not compulsory but advised. Lycra however is!                                  

Do I have to be a member of Port Sunlight Wheelers?
Riders do not have to be a member to come along and ride with us to start, however if you ride regularly with us then membership would be an expectation. There is a once yearly fee of currently £20 that enables you access all the activities and experience the club has to offer, not to mention our lovely kit!

Liability and Insurance: 
While the organisers of the ride will do all in their reasonable control to make the ride as safe as possible, all riders take part at their own risk. It is highly recommended that all riders have some form of insurance (at least 3rd party liability) Please see terms and conditions at the foot of the page.

data.meetingPoint:
Come and join our friendly Saturday morning Women's Club Rides!
We are a friendly group of women who are keen to invite more women to come along and join our great club "The Port Sunlight Wheelers". We are delighted with the addition of Women Only rides to our club and the increase in female riders it is bringing.

To support more women we are currently running an easier paced fortnightly ride "Sunlight Women's Easy Rider!" from Nets Cafe, Burton (on each alternate fortnight to our regular Sunlight Women's Club Ride - also on this web site). This ride is for women who are already riding regularly but wish to gain experience of group riding, including speed and endurance. They aim to join the regular Women's Club Run by late spring 2018. The "easy rider" will then cease and become a Women's Club Ride as below hopefully with enough women to run weekly.
There is no expectation that you should join the club until you are riding on the longer Women's Club Ride.

The Easy Rider rides will gradually increase between 25-40miles with the aim of riding similar routes on the map shown at about 14-15mph average speed by the Summer. We do not usually have a cafe stop so make sure you bring enough fluids & fuel to sustain you.
We meet fortnightly at Nets Café, Burton Marsh at about 9am for a cuppa and a chat before leaving at 9.30am. Free parking available alongside the marsh on the road at the bottom of Denhall lane (or if full in the cafe). If you don't want a cuppa first just meet outside the cafe at 9.30am.
My contact details are below...let me know you are coming so I can look out for you ;)

Our Women's Club Rides offer a fun and supportive way for women who want to ride at club level without the anxieties and pressures that sometimes women can feel at the thought of riding with a male dominated club ride. You can choose to stay with the Women's Rides, or use it as a stepping stone to the traditional Sunday Club Rides or indeed dip in and out of both, it's a good alternative if you can't make a Sunday. The wider club offers lots of opportunities and a wealth of knowledge for those who wish to try out time-trial or cyclo-cross, as well as the annual club cycling weekend away, trips abroad or social events and of course access to our lovely club kit! There are also events for children of members (The Women's rides are for adult women over 16 years old).

The longer Women's Club Rides will take you into rolling Cheshire or the Welsh hills and are around 40-50 miles long at about 14-15mph average speed, depending on terrain and conditions. Whilst you would be expected to be of a certain capability we will not leave anyone behind and always wait on hills. Also we do not usually have a cafe stop so make sure you bring enough fluids and fuel to sustain you.

**INFORMATION** For all rides please make sure you fit the minimum fitness requirements and are riding a road bike (drop handlebars) with clipped in pedals. Please see FAQ on Sunlight Women's Rides Group for appropriate equipment, clothing, nutrition etc.

We look forward to welcoming you!
Best Wishes Nicky

Please note none of our rides are suitable for novice/occasional/leisure riders, hybrid bikes or for flat pedals. Riders could instead look at Breeze rides on this website or Wirral Belles (google) .
If you need more info or to check if our rides are for you then please send me a message:
on this website send me a buddy request and I will message you
facebook @sunlightwomenscycling
email velospeed123@gmail.com

data.name: Rural Ride to Rowlands Castle
data.description: PLEASE NOTE LATER START TIME OF 10AM.  Havant Breeze rides will start slightly later than usual during winter months January-March.2018 starts with a leisurely ride to Rowlands Castle via Westbourne.   We'll cycle mainly on quiet roads and country lanes.  There are a couple of slightly challenging hills along the way. We will ride at a leisurely pace and no-one will be left behind. We'll take a break at Tea on the Green in the village of Rowlands Castle before heading back up Redhill (a short but moderate hill).  Tea on the Green is a popular cyclists cafe.Please ensure your tyres are fully inflated and bring a lock.Havant Leisure Centre has a pay and display car park for anyone wishing to drive to the starting point (£1 for unlimited parking at weekends).  It is also a short distance from the station.If you are new to Breeze take a look at our facebook page BREEZE NETWORK SOLENT. There are lots of photos of previous rides which will give you an idea of Breeze rides. If you have any questions I can be contacted at teresa.goodyer@btinternet.com. Hope to meet you on a Breeze ride soon!
data.beta:formattedDescription:
PLEASE NOTE LATER START TIME OF 10AM.
Havant Breeze rides will start slightly later than usual during winter months January-March.
2018 starts with a leisurely ride to Rowlands Castle via Westbourne. We'll cycle mainly on quiet roads and country lanes. There are a couple of slightly challenging hills along the way. We will ride at a leisurely pace and no-one will be left behind. We'll take a break at Tea on the Green in the village of Rowlands Castle before heading back up Redhill (a short but moderate hill). Tea on the Green is a popular cyclists cafe.

Please ensure your tyres are fully inflated and bring a lock.

Havant Leisure Centre has a pay and display car park for anyone wishing to drive to the starting point (£1 for unlimited parking at weekends). It is also a short distance from the station.

If you are new to Breeze take a look at our facebook page BREEZE NETWORK SOLENT. There are lots of photos of previous rides which will give you an idea of Breeze rides.
If you have any questions I can be contacted at teresa.goodyer@btinternet.com. Hope to meet you on a Breeze ride soon!

Breeze is all about remembering how good it is to ride a bike with friends. Organised by
British Cycling trained Breeze Champions, these free rides explore local, accessible routes, around the Lincoln area in small friendly groups.
Rides are taking place all year round and are ideal for women who are looking to get back
on a bike and are a great way to make new friends.

data.name: Breeze Pootle to Houghton Hall Park
data.description: This is an ideal ride for anyone thinking about getting back on a bike or just a confidence booster.Join me for a short ride to the newly opened Visitors center at Houghton Hall Park. The kitchen garden has been reinstated within the gardens & formal gardens that once stood beside the hall also have been restored to their formal glory providing a scenic view across the park, the perfect spot for a stop. Bring some money & we can visit the fully equipped café offering a wide range of drinks & light bites or if you'd prefer, we could do some laps around the beautiful picturesque Park with many new landscape features all waiting to be established by nature. #BreezeThroughWinterDuring January and February, BREEZE are rewarding those of you who ride 4 or more Breeze rides with an amazing goody bag full of cycling surprises. So don’t delay, look out for those POP-UP rides, book on, turn up, ride and receive your prize. Happy winter cycling Please make sure your bike is ride worthy & bring a spare inner tube & helmet
data.beta:formattedDescription:
This is an ideal ride for anyone thinking about getting back on a bike or just a confidence booster.
Join me for a short ride to the newly opened Visitors center at Houghton Hall Park. The kitchen garden has been reinstated within the gardens & formal gardens that once stood beside the hall also have been restored to their formal glory providing a scenic view across the park, the perfect spot for a stop. Bring some money & we can visit the fully equipped café offering a wide range of drinks & light bites or if you'd prefer, we could do some laps around the beautiful picturesque Park with many new landscape features all waiting to be established by nature.

#BreezeThroughWinter
During January and February, BREEZE are rewarding those of you who ride 4 or more Breeze rides with an amazing goody bag full of cycling surprises. So don’t delay, look out for those POP-UP rides, book on, turn up, ride and receive your prize. Happy winter cycling

Please make sure your bike is ride worthy & bring a spare inner tube & helmet

data.name: Breeze Through Winter Dunstable to Edlesborough loop
data.description: Join us as we ride into 2018 with #BreezeThroughWinter. We know that getting back on the saddle after the festive period can be easier said than done, so this New Year Breeze will be rewarding everyone who completes four HSBC UK Breeze rides from 1 January until 28 February with a goody bag.  This is the first of four rides that HSBC UK Breeze Dunstable is organizing.We will meet at Creasey Park, Dunstable, and ride from here out on the lanes to Edlesborough, stop planned for coffee & cake break at the Heirloom café (http://www.heirloom.cafe/) and then a loop back to Dunstable, planned total time 2.5 hours. This is a short 9 mile ride, but should be nice to get on bikes locally again :-) It is recommended when riding in winter to dress in layers, with special attention to feet and hands.  Do bring a spare inner tube with you, even if you are not confident to do on your own there are plenty of people who can help.

data.name: Richmond Ride : Twickenham to Box Hill
data.description: Our traditional post-turkey jaunt but a bit later to avoid clash with Kingston.  On/off road quiet and scenic route to Box Hill then a steady climb to the viewpoint and lunch in NT Cafe at the top (as the pub we used to patronise is now a trendy wine-bar). Enjoy  a switchback descent taking us most of the way home. About 40 miles in total. Better bring lights but expect to get back before 4.

data.name: Exploring the back roads to Wragby and back
data.description: This is a flattish ride from Market Rasen to Wragby, exploring the back roads around the area. The pace is going to be steady, around 12mph, but no one will be left behind. The route takes us through the villages of Legsby and West Torrington before arriving at Wragy for refreshments. Fully refreshed we head back to Market Rasen via Holton Cum Beckering, Snelland, Wickenby and Linwood. Remember to bring a spare inner tube and a working pump as well as money for refreshments at Wragby. The elevation looks terrible but the different in height from the lowest and highest is around 75 feet. It has a total of 479 feet of climbing according to Strava.

data.name: Breeze to Hartley Wintney from the FBC Centre
data.description: Leaving the FBC Centre, we will ride down to Hartley Wintney for a café stop, enjoying some picturesque scenery on the way. The route is on quieter roads wherever possible and the terrain is definitely "undulating" - but where there's an up, there's a down! Given the recent rains,we will NOT go through the Bramshill plantation so this route is suitable for road bikes too. Also, please note that the pace is going to be steady ( around 10 mph) . If you want to go slower or faster then this isn't the right ride for you :-)It's a good idea to bring with you a drink, some money for the café stop, a spare inner tube for your bike, a pump and a waterproof. Hopefully by bringing the latter two things, you will need neither.

data.name: Breeze Pootle to Houghton Hall Park
data.description: This is an ideal ride for anyone thinking about getting back on a bike or just a confidence booster.Join me for a short ride to the newly opened Visitors center at Houghton Hall Park. The kitchen garden has been reinstated within the gardens & formal gardens that once stood beside the hall also have been restored to their formal glory providing a scenic view across the park, the perfect spot for a stop. Bring some money & we can visit the fully equipped café offering a wide range of drinks & light bites or if you'd prefer, we could do some laps around the beautiful picturesque Park with many new landscape features all waiting to be established by nature. #BreezeThroughWinterDuring January and February, BREEZE are rewarding those of you who ride 4 or more Breeze rides with an amazing goody bag full of cycling surprises. So don’t delay, look out for those POP-UP rides, book on, turn up, ride and receive your prize. Happy winter cycling Please make sure your bike is ride worthy & bring a spare inner tube & helmet
data.beta:formattedDescription:

Bring some money & we can visit the fully equipped café offering a wide range of drinks & light bites or if you'd prefer, we could do some laps around the beautiful picturesque Park with many new landscape features all waiting to be established by nature.

Please make sure your bike is ride worthy & bring a spare inner tube & helmet

organizer.name: The London Cycling Club
organizer.description:
The club made up mainly of cyclists from all parts of London and all kinds of backgrounds. Membership is free as are the many social cycle rides we organize, normally on midweek evenings and weekends. ​​
​
We often have themed rides, where we visit places of interest,
learn particular history of an area or have a ride with a lovely views. 
A food/pub stop is common on our rides,and we always ensure that our bikes are safe.

data.name: Get Back on Your Bike in 2018 - Beginners Ride
data.description: This ride is for women who have not been on a bike for a long time and who need some support and confidence to ride their bike. We will do some practicing in the back car park of the Rugby Club before heading down the cycle path (Lon Las Ogwen) to Tregarth and back.  The cycle path goes through the new Tynal Tywyll which is really exciting to ride through! The route is  flat, is traffic free and as there are 6 gates to open each way there will be lots of opportunities to catch your breath :-)As long as you can ride a bike (remember, if you did it as a kid you will still be able to!!), and your bike is safe then this ride is suitable for you, regardless of your current fitness level.  I can help you get your bike out / off the car if needed. Please give this ride a try if you want to get back on your bike, it is friendly and supportive and safe.

data.name: Wheel Do It! - Wheel wander around Wigtwizzle (with Paul)
data.description: This ride starts with a steady climb up Loxley Road before passing the Nag's Head and to the right of Damflask Reservoir, up the hill and through High Bradfield. Here we’re rewarded with fine views across Loxley Valley before passing through the village and up another shorter but slightly steeper hill that takes us to a right and a further steady climb up Bolsterstone Road. After a lovely swooping downhill section and a few modest ups and downs we reach Wigtwizzle where another climb takes us to a left turn on to Mortimer Road. There is then a bit of steady climbing and a longish descent before the first of two short, steep climbs that take past the Strines Inn. After a couple of miles of flat or slightly uphill road across the moor we turn left and it is then mostly downhill to Low Bradfield where we will have a coffee stop at the Flask End cafe before an easy few miles back to the start. Although there are some longish climbs in this ride and a few challenging hills, we’ll take it steady and stop for breathers whenever we need to. If you need to walk up any of the steeper bits, that is fine – we won’t leave anyone behind.IMPORTANT INFORMATION FOR PARTICIPANTSWe recommend that all participants wear a helmet. Please make sure you wear appropriate clothing for the weather. As usual we do expect you to have ensured your bike is roadworthy and that you have carried out basic pre-ride checks; we recommend that you also carry at least one spare inner tube, a pump (CO2 inflators are also highly recommended). It is also a good idea to carry a spare chain link that matches your bike’s chain (e.g. 9, 10 or 11 speed). If you have a mechanical problem we will do our best to assist you and/or lend you an inner tube or repair kit if we can, but it is always best to be self-reliant. Don’t forget to bring money for refreshments and a mobile phone.DISCLAIMER	This is a purely social group of like-minded people sharing a love of cycling, it is not a formal organisation nor does it have any form of legal structure. We do not profess to be trained ride leaders but do have experience of doing so. You are free to choose to ride with us but in doing so please note that you do so in acceptance that this is entirely at your own risk. We cannot accept responsibility for any loss or injury suffered as a result of your participation. Please also read the terms and conditions on the website.

After a lovely swooping downhill section and a few modest ups and downs we reach Wigtwizzle where another climb takes us to a left turn on to Mortimer Road. There is then a bit of steady climbing and a longish descent before the first of two short, steep climbs that take past the Strines Inn. After a couple of miles of flat or slightly uphill road across the moor we turn left and it is then mostly downhill to Low Bradfield where we will have a coffee stop at the Flask End cafe before an easy few miles back to the start.
Although there are some longish climbs in this ride and a few challenging hills, we’ll take it steady and stop for breathers whenever we need to. If you need to walk up any of the steeper bits, that is fine – we won’t leave anyone behind.
IMPORTANT INFORMATION FOR PARTICIPANTS
We recommend that all participants wear a helmet. Please make sure you wear appropriate clothing for the weather.
As usual we do expect you to have ensured your bike is roadworthy and that you have carried out basic pre-ride checks; we recommend that you also carry at least one spare inner tube, a pump (CO2 inflators are also highly recommended). It is also a good idea to carry a spare chain link that matches your bike’s chain (e.g. 9, 10 or 11 speed). If you have a mechanical problem we will do our best to assist you and/or lend you an inner tube or repair kit if we can, but it is always best to be self-reliant. Don’t forget to bring money for refreshments and a mobile phone.
DISCLAIMER
This is a purely social group of like-minded people sharing a love of cycling, it is not a formal organisation nor does it have any form of legal structure. You are free to choose to ride with us but in doing so please note that you do so in acceptance that this is entirely at your own risk. organizer.name: Wheel Do It!
organizer.description:
This mixed group is the one to join if you are looking to gradually increase the distances you can ride and the hills you can climb. The plan is to create a series of rides that will allow you to gradually build up your stamina, ride further and climb higher.

Be sure to join our Facebook group so that you can keep up to date with what is going on!

data.name: Beautiful beginners Chesham
data.description: We will meet outside The Elgiva theatre for brief introduction, warm up and bike check. There is parking and it's 1.40 for two hoursWe will head out through town via Berhmapsted road towards Cholesbury and Hawridge. This is a flat, quieter country road and good place to get your confidence. You can park at the theatre and we will be returning to this start point.Terrain is flat, with some rough surfaces but very suitable for road bikes. If the group feel able, we can extend our distance on the day but this is a very good ride to start on if just starting cycling.We ride at the pace of the slowest rider and always wait so that no one is left behind.Please remember to ensure your bike is road worthy, with tyres pumped up and bring enough water. Bring some money as we can go for a drink after if the group wish to.The ride is weather dependant and if I think it could affect your safety, mine and dampen our enjoyment, I will cancel.
data.beta:formattedDescription:
We will meet outside The Elgiva theatre for brief introduction, warm up and bike check. There is parking and it's 1.40 for two hours
We will head out through town via Berhmapsted road towards Cholesbury and Hawridge. This is a flat, quieter country road and good place to get your confidence. You can park at the theatre and we will be returning to this start point.

Terrain is flat, with some rough surfaces but very suitable for road bikes. If the group feel able, we can extend our distance on the day but this is a very good ride to start on if just starting cycling.

We ride at the pace of the slowest rider and always wait so that no one is left behind.

Please remember to ensure your bike is road worthy, with tyres pumped up and bring enough water. Bring some money as we can go for a drink after if the group wish to.

The ride is weather dependant and if I think it could affect your safety, mine and dampen our enjoyment, I will cancel.

data.name: Watford Cycle Hub: Denham Delights, Pace Average: 8-10 mph
data.description: Join us on a relaxed 'Steady Plus' Sunday ride which takes in cycle paths and quiet country lanes, with one busier section on the A412 towards the beautiful village of Denham. In the village we ride past gorgeous houses and pubs to the Country Park, where we pause for refreshments in the café. Our return takes us up a hill near a golf club after which we are rewarded with some lovely countryside views. Heading past Denham airfield we then have a gentle ride back to Watford Cycle Hub, where you can have another cuppa or chat to the team before heading home.NB: This route is best suited to hybrids. Road bikers: this route is do-able on a road bike provided you don't mind a bit of mud and cycling on a few rougher sections on the Grand Union Canal towpath. Mtbs will be fine; you're just getting more of a work out on the couple of climbs (139 metres in total for this route, which is mainly flat).Your Ride Leaders for this group looking to average between 8-10 mph over the route are: Yves Remedios & Tom Barber.There are two pace categories for this ride: the other group is a 10-11 mph group and the link to that version of the ride is here, should that pace category better suit you:https://www.letsride.co.uk/rides/watford-cycle-hub-denham-delights-pace-average-10-11-mphPlease bring money for the cafe if you want to buy refreshments at this week's coffee stop. :)Please also bring two spare inner tubes in case of puncture - as changing an inner tube is faster than getting out the rubber glue. The Ride Leader will happily help if anyone in the group has a puncture on the day. Watford Cycle Hub sell inner tubes from £4 new, or recycled ones for 50p patched, £1 with no patches, should you need to purchase one. Please check your bike is in good working order before the ride - especially that your brakes are working & your tyres are pumped.If your bike might need a little more TLC or hasn't been ridden for a while, you can always bring it in for a free assessment; we're Not-For-Profit, do free bike assessments and promise to give you an honest price if your bike needs fixing, fine tuning or a full service. :)If you're running late on the day, please call Watford Cycle Hub on: 01923 223994. data.beta:formattedDescription:
Join us on a relaxed 'Steady Plus' Sunday ride which takes in cycle paths and quiet country lanes, with one busier section on the A412 towards the beautiful village of Denham. In the village we ride past gorgeous houses and pubs to the Country Park, where we pause for refreshments in the café. Our return takes us up a hill near a golf club after which we are rewarded with some lovely countryside views. Heading past Denham airfield we then have a gentle ride back to Watford Cycle Hub, where you can have another cuppa or chat to the team before heading home.

NB: This route is best suited to hybrids. Road bikers: this route is do-able on a road bike provided you don't mind a bit of mud and cycling on a few rougher sections on the Grand Union Canal towpath. Mtbs will be fine; you're just getting more of a work out on the couple of climbs (139 metres in total for this route, which is mainly flat).

Your Ride Leaders for this group looking to average between 8-10 mph over the route are: Yves Remedios & Tom Barber.

There are two pace categories for this ride: the other group is a 10-11 mph group and the link to that version of the ride is here, should that pace category better suit you:

https://www.letsride.co.uk/rides/watford-cycle-hub-denham-delights-pace-average-10-11-mph

Please bring money for the cafe if you want to buy refreshments at this week's coffee stop. :)

Please also bring two spare inner tubes in case of puncture - as changing an inner tube is faster than getting out the rubber glue. The Ride Leader will happily help if anyone in the group has a puncture on the day. Watford Cycle Hub sell inner tubes from £4 new, or recycled ones for 50p patched, £1 with no patches, should you need to purchase one.

Please check your bike is in good working order before the ride - especially that your brakes are working & your tyres are pumped.

If your bike might need a little more TLC or hasn't been ridden for a while, you can always bring it in for a free assessment; we're Not-For-Profit, do free bike assessments and promise to give you an honest price if your bike needs fixing, fine tuning or a full service. :)

If you're running late on the day, please call Watford Cycle Hub on: 01923 223994. We may be able to wait for you - if we know you are on your way! :)

data.name: Ride through winter Coypool to Yelverton steady daytime ride
data.description: We will ride from Coypool up the Plym trail to Yelverton. The trail is suitable for any bike. There is a slight incline on the way up and a nice easy roll back down. There is only one small hill along a road at Clearbrook. We will stop at a café so bring some new pound coins along. Please wear a helmet and bring lights if you have them for the tunnel. Please bring a spare inner tube to fit your tyres and check that your bike is in good working order. We will ride on to Longash Garden Centre Cafe.

data.name: Hearts Delight Loop 12 - 14mph no drop
data.description: The route starts from the carpark between Ranelagh cycle warehouse and Jacks Cafe, heads out to washbrook the route then flattens and continues towards little & Great Wenham before looping round to Holten st Mary & East Bergholt before decending to cattawade where the route takes a right turn and leaves our home county and enters Essex, passing through manningtree and mistley we reach our cafe stop at hearts delight in Lawford.After a short break for refreshment We will head out from lawford back to manningtree and back into suffolk passing cattawade, Brantham, Stutton, Holbrook and Freston before decending under the orwell bridge and into ipswich to the cult cafe where the ride will terminate.

data.name: TFCC - January Starter Ride - 10 - 20 Miles
data.description: TFCC - Traffic Free Cycling Club Rides use the network of canal towpaths, cycle lanes and tracks avoiding the road as much as possible. We ride at the pace of the slowest ride ensuring that the group stays together, and the speed is about 8 - 10 mph.We will decide on the route on the morning of the ride, taking into account the weather, and ability of riders.  We will be out for approximately 3 hours with stops included the latest I hope to return to West Drayton is 2pm which allows some contingency for punctures, or if we as a group would like to cycle a bit longer/further.The potential routes venues for January are as followsCranford ParkHarmondsworth MoorLangley & Black ParksWindsor Denham Country ParkAll rides will be circular, and as we are a Traffic Free Cycling Club we will be using potentially muddy paths, bumpy canals and other such delights but with the benefit of NO CARS where possible.Look forward to meet up with old and new members, let's make January 2018 the best one yet.
data.beta:formattedDescription:
TFCC - Traffic Free Cycling Club Rides use the network of canal towpaths, cycle lanes and tracks avoiding the road as much as possible. We ride at the pace of the slowest ride ensuring that the group stays together, and the speed is about 8 - 10 mph.

We will decide on the route on the morning of the ride, taking into account the weather, and ability of riders. We will be out for approximately 3 hours with stops included the latest I hope to return to West Drayton is 2pm which allows some contingency for punctures, or if we as a group would like to cycle a bit longer/further.

The potential routes venues for January are as follows

Cranford Park
Harmondsworth Moor
Langley & Black Parks
Windsor
Denham Country Park

All rides will be circular, and as we are a Traffic Free Cycling Club we will be using potentially muddy paths, bumpy canals and other such delights but with the benefit of NO CARS where possible.

Look forward to meet up with old and new members, let's make January 2018 the best one yet.

organizer.name: TFCC - Traffic Free Cycling Club
organizer.description:
Why is this group different to others?

This group is all about social riding, with the emphasis on being as much off road as possible, so due to the different terrains it’s not all about speed.

I usually try and create rides in line with what events are going on in the local area, such as Minet Park Festival, Denham Park Country fayre etc.

Why don’t people cycle more often?

Well speaking for myself, it’s all about the dangers of the road and having the opportunity to check out the local wildlife whilst cycling.  This makes the rides more enjoyable and more sociable. 

Where does this group cycle and distances?

All rides start from West Drayton Train Station (WDS) near the bike racks, the terrains usually involve bridleways/cycle lanes/canal tow paths.  Here are some examples

3 Parks – Langley, Black & Denham Parks approximately 20-30 Miles

Pub 2 Pub – Malt Shovel to the sister pub Coy Carp – 10 – 15 Miles

Park 2 Park – Minet and Cranford Parks 15 – 20 Miles

Big Park Route – Osterley and Richmond – 30+ Miles

Cycle London – Cycling into London for the prudential Freecycle Ride – 60 Miles

A to B – Ashford Staines to Brighton – 60+ Miles

Interested In Joining

We have a facebook group - TFCC Facebook Group  just join the group.

We advertise on the Hillingdon Council Events - Hillingdon Events

Contact ME – Hannah Dunn on 07867824809

data.name: TFCC - January Starter Ride - 10 - 20 Miles
data.description: TFCC - Traffic Free Cycling Club Rides use the network of canal towpaths, cycle lanes and tracks avoiding the road as much as possible. We ride at the pace of the slowest ride ensuring that the group stays together, and the speed is about 8 - 10 mph.We will decide on the route on the morning of the ride, taking into account the weather, and ability of riders.  We will be out for approximately 3 hours with stops included the latest I hope to return to West Drayton is 6pm which allows some contingency for punctures, or if we as a group would like to cycle a bit longer/further.The potential routes venues for January are as followsCranford ParkHarmondsworth MoorLangley & Black ParksWindsor Denham Country ParkAll rides will be circular, and as we are a Traffic Free Cycling Club we will be using potentially muddy paths, bumpy canals and other such delights but with the benefit of NO CARS where possible.Look forward to meet up with old and new members, let's make January 2018 the best one yet.
data.beta:formattedDescription:
TFCC - Traffic Free Cycling Club Rides use the network of canal towpaths, cycle lanes and tracks avoiding the road as much as possible. We ride at the pace of the slowest ride ensuring that the group stays together, and the speed is about 8 - 10 mph.

We will decide on the route on the morning of the ride, taking into account the weather, and ability of riders. We will be out for approximately 3 hours with stops included the latest I hope to return to West Drayton is 6pm which allows some contingency for punctures, or if we as a group would like to cycle a bit longer/further.

The potential routes venues for January are as follows

Cranford Park
Harmondsworth Moor
Langley & Black Parks
Windsor
Denham Country Park

All rides will be circular, and as we are a Traffic Free Cycling Club we will be using potentially muddy paths, bumpy canals and other such delights but with the benefit of NO CARS where possible.

Look forward to meet up with old and new members, let's make January 2018 the best one yet.

organizer.name: TFCC - Traffic Free Cycling Club
organizer.description:
Why is this group different to others?

This group is all about social riding, with the emphasis on being as much off road as possible, so due to the different terrains it’s not all about speed.

I usually try and create rides in line with what events are going on in the local area, such as Minet Park Festival, Denham Park Country fayre etc.

Why don’t people cycle more often?

Well speaking for myself, it’s all about the dangers of the road and having the opportunity to check out the local wildlife whilst cycling.  This makes the rides more enjoyable and more sociable. 

Where does this group cycle and distances?

All rides start from West Drayton Train Station (WDS) near the bike racks, the terrains usually involve bridleways/cycle lanes/canal tow paths.  Here are some examples

3 Parks – Langley, Black & Denham Parks approximately 20-30 Miles

Pub 2 Pub – Malt Shovel to the sister pub Coy Carp – 10 – 15 Miles

Park 2 Park – Minet and Cranford Parks 15 – 20 Miles

Big Park Route – Osterley and Richmond – 30+ Miles

Cycle London – Cycling into London for the prudential Freecycle Ride – 60 Miles

A to B – Ashford Staines to Brighton – 60+ Miles

Interested In Joining

We have a facebook group - TFCC Facebook Group  just join the group.

We advertise on the Hillingdon Council Events - Hillingdon Events

Contact ME – Hannah Dunn on 07867824809

data.name: Dulwich Healthy Ride
data.description: Route passes many sites of interest. Start Dulwich Park, then up to Dawsons Heights for the view. Next across to Dulwich Hamlet football stadium and down Greendale to Dulwich Village.  Continuing south past Dulwich Picture Gallery and Dulwich College to the only Toll Gate in London. Then loop up to Kingswood House, aka Bovril Castle, back through Bel Air Park, on to Herne Hill Velodrome, and back to Dulwich Park.

data.name: Let's Ride Ennerdale Cycle Circuit
data.description: Whether you're new to cycling or an experienced rider, this is a fantastic opportunity to come and experience riding around the brand new purpose built cycling facility at Ennerdale Leisure Centre for FREE. The session is open to everyone regardless of ability. The only criteria is that you can ride a BIKE. You can do 1 lap or 20! The Ride Leaders will be there to give you useful tips and advice and will even cycle around the track with you if you need us to. If anyone wants to go a little faster, you are welcome to ride around at your own pace. It is your hour so feel free to use it to suit your needs.The session time is 1830 - 1930 and there is a secure car park and toilet/changing facilities inside the sports centre. What to wear? Anything comfy, warm and waterproof! Please remember to bring bike lights with you...and a spare inner tube if you can.To find the secure parking area, turn right once you've entered the Ennerdale car park and drive to the cycle track gate which will be open for you. The parking is right next to the track. If you need assistance, there will be someone on hand to help you lift your bike out of the car.Come along and bring a friend. You'll be made very welcome!
data.beta:formattedDescription:
Whether you're new to cycling or an experienced rider, this is a fantastic opportunity to come and experience riding around the brand new purpose built cycling facility at Ennerdale Leisure Centre for FREE. The session is open to everyone regardless of ability. The only criteria is that you can ride a BIKE. You can do 1 lap or 20!

The Ride Leaders will be there to give you useful tips and advice and will even cycle around the track with you if you need us to. If anyone wants to go a little faster, you are welcome to ride around at your own pace. It is your hour so feel free to use it to suit your needs.

The session time is 1830 - 1930 and there is a secure car park and toilet/changing facilities inside the sports centre. What to wear? Anything comfy, warm and waterproof! Please remember to bring bike lights with you...and a spare inner tube if you can.

To find the secure parking area, turn right once you've entered the Ennerdale car park and drive to the cycle track gate which will be open for you. The parking is right next to the track. If you need assistance, there will be someone on hand to help you lift your bike out of the car.

Come along and bring a friend. You'll be made very welcome!
data.accessibilityInformation: This route has been British Cycling assessed as an accessible route, meaning it is suitable for the majority of adaptive bikes. The route will have no or low levels of traffic, there will be plenty of space and will have a good surface throughout. If you have any questions about using this route on an adaptive bike on this ride, please use the red 'Contact Us' button below or call 0161 274 2000 and ask for the Recreation team.

data.name: New Year New You Short Ride
data.description: A ladies only ride specifically for those new to cycling or returning, this is a gentle 10 miles (round trip) to Loynton Fisheries near Norbury, where we will stop to enjoy cake and a coffee. So who is this ride for? Well, maybe you are nervous about riding on the road? in a group? or just need to see if you can go a bit further than you normally do? This ride is aimed at you, come and give it a go! Your ride Leaders ( Breeze Champions) will be with you all the  way , you will be supported and no one is left behind.The ride is suitable for road bikes or hybrid bikes ( not nobbly tyres we do not go off road.) The pace will be steady and gentle. Friendly and fun.Go on... book it ....You know you want to!Contact Your Ride Leader Kacey on 07920 130683 if you have any questions.

data.name: Beautiful Beginners in Pinner!
data.description: New Year, new you? Cycling is a fun, free and friendly way to get some exercise. Local qualified volunteers have easy beginner rides for women, based in Pinner Village Gardens - the park between Rayners Lane, Whittington Way and Cannon Lane - by kind permission of Harrow Council. Come along on a Saturday morning for an hour-long session, followed by optional refreshments at the Pinner Arms. Just make sure your trousers aren’t baggy and won’t get caught in the chain; and dress for the weather. You do need: a working bike. Beg, borrow or buy a bike, pump up the tyres, check the brakes and make sure the wheels turn.You don't need: fancy lycra clothes, a helmet, an expensive bike, or to be super-fit. Breeze riders come in all shapes, sizes and ages but we are all FRIENDLY! Come and give it a go. If you complete four rides over January and February you'll get a Breeze goody bag.

data.name: Faversham Village Rides- Macknade to Chilham Route 1
data.description: This is a HSBC UK Breeze Ride, led by women for women. Ride leaders are called Breeze Champions and are trained as level 1 or level 2 ride leaders by British Cycling. They are all volunteers and hold current first aid certificates. We will take time to enjoy the beautiful countryside as we wind our way through the villages of Selling and Shottenden to reach our refreshment stop at Chilham. We will return to Faversham via the hamlets of Rhode Common, South Street and Brenly. A very pretty ride!Please remember your.....- spare inner tube, pump and tools needed if you don't have quick release wheels- water bottle(s)- suitable clothing - money for refreshments- a contact number for a lift/assistance in case of mechanical breakdown!! (ride leaders are not trained mechanics!)Please check your bike over before you leave for the ride eg. brakes, tyres, chain, gears etc.!!Any questions or for further information please contact Fiona on 07414254116.
data.beta:formattedDescription:
This is a HSBC UK Breeze Ride, led by women for women. Ride leaders are called Breeze Champions and are trained as level 1 or level 2 ride leaders by British Cycling. They are all volunteers and hold current first aid certificates.

We will take time to enjoy the beautiful countryside as we wind our way through the villages of Selling and Shottenden to reach our refreshment stop at Chilham. We will return to Faversham via the hamlets of Rhode Common, South Street and Brenly. A very pretty ride!

Please remember your.....
- spare inner tube, pump and tools needed if you don't have quick release wheels
- water bottle(s)
- suitable clothing
- money for refreshments
- a contact number for a lift/assistance in case of mechanical breakdown!! (ride leaders are not trained mechanics!)

Please check your bike over before you leave for the ride eg. brakes, tyres, chain, gears etc.!!


Any questions or for further information please contact Fiona on 07414254116.

data.name: Canterbury Village Rides - Toddler's Cove to the Sondes Tea House Selling
data.description: This is a HSBC UK Breeze Ride, led by women for women. Ride leaders are called Breeze Champions and are trained as level 1 or level 2 ride leaders by British Cycling. They are all volunteers and hold current first aid certificates.This friendly sociable ride will follow the beautiful Great Stour Way (cycle route 18) out of Canterbury to Chartham. We will then make our way through Shalmsford Street along the A28 to Chilham where we will turn off to Perry Woods and Selling. We will stop at the Sondes Tea House before making our way back to Chartham via Old Wives Lees, then pick up the Great Stour Way back to Canterbury. A lovely varied route!Please remember your.....- spare inner tube, pump and tools needed if you don't have quick release wheels- water bottle(s)- suitable clothing - money for refreshments- a contact number for a lift/assistance in case of mechanical breakdown!! (ride leaders are not trained mechanics!)Please check your bike over before you leave for the ride eg. brakes, tyres, chain, gears etc.!!Any questions or for further information please contact Fiona on 07414254116.

data.name: Battersea Breeze Challenge Clapham Common to Downe
data.description: Challenging ride out through London suburbs and into leafy Kent lanes.  Some serious climbs and descents (over 2000 ft elevation gain according to Strava!)  But we will take at a relatively relaxed pace and there is a great cafe stop at Downe House, with lots of cake on offer. Please bring snacks/sandwiches/gels to keep you going on the ride as we will only make the one formal stop.  We should be back by 3pm. You must bring a spare inner tube to fit your bike in case of a puncture. Please note the finish point is NOT Crystal Palace as shown on the map below.  We will return to Clapham Common.  From Crystal Palace the route back is the same as the route out.
data.beta:formattedDescription:
Challenging ride out through London suburbs and into leafy Kent lanes. Some serious climbs and descents (over 2000 ft elevation gain according to Strava!) But we will take at a relatively relaxed pace and there is a great cafe stop at Downe House, with lots of cake on offer.

Please bring snacks/sandwiches/gels to keep you going on the ride as we will only make the one formal stop. We should be back by 3pm.

You must bring a spare inner tube to fit your bike in case of a puncture.

Please note the finish point is NOT Crystal Palace as shown on the map below. We will return to Clapham Common. From Crystal Palace the route back is the same as the route out.

data.name: Country Lane Cycling - Night Riding
data.description: This ride will start from Bingham Town Market Square (near the Butter Cross) and will be approx 10-14 miles. It will be a gentle paced ride cycling along some quiet country lanes surrounding Bingham. The ride is aimed at women that have not been on their bikes for a while (ie: you are used to doing slightly more mileage but just need something to ease yourself back in) or are new to cycling. However, it is also an introduction to group cycling in the darkPlease make sure you have a road worthy bike, suitable clothing and a helmet. Lights will need be fitted to the front and rear of your bike.  It is also advisable to bring a spare inner tube and a pump. You may also wish to bring water to keep hydrated and a snack for sustenancePlease note:  The Vale of Belvoir Cycling Club also meet on Bingham Market Place, so please do not be alarmed if you see a bunch of cyclists in full on Lycra and on road bikes that don't look like they belong on a BREEZE ride..   They meet on the corner of the market place.

data.name: Battersea Breeze Short Ride:Clapham Common, Westminster and Battersea Park
data.description: A ride along quiet back roads (Sustrans London Cycle Route 3) through Clapham, Vauxhall and Kennington;a constantly changing urban landscape - emerging on to the Embankment at Lambeth Bridge. Great views of Parliament and the London Eye as we walk our bikes over Lambeth Bridge, then head back through quiet Westminster streets along the north bank of the Thames, past Tate Britain and Dolphin Square.Lots of river views on the final section of the ride along the shared cycle/pedestrian path on the Chelsea Embankment, before crossing over to the south bank of the river on London's prettiest bridge - the Albert Bridge.  We then do a traffic free circuit of Battersea Park and return to Clapham Common for our end of ride cafe stop at the Bandstand Cafe.This ride is all on tarmac, and mostly flat other than a short climb back up to Clapham Common at the end, so suitable for all types of bikes, including Boris bikes. Be prepared for wintry and/or wet weather e.g. thermals, warm gloves and socks, and a waterproof jacket.We'll look forward to seeing you there!Judith and Victoria
data.beta:formattedDescription:
A ride along quiet back roads (Sustrans London Cycle Route 3) through Clapham, Vauxhall and Kennington;a constantly changing urban landscape - emerging on to the Embankment at Lambeth Bridge. Great views of Parliament and the London Eye as we walk our bikes over Lambeth Bridge, then head back through quiet Westminster streets along the north bank of the Thames, past Tate Britain and Dolphin Square.

Lots of river views on the final section of the ride along the shared cycle/pedestrian path on the Chelsea Embankment, before crossing over to the south bank of the river on London's prettiest bridge - the Albert Bridge. We then do a traffic free circuit of Battersea Park and return to Clapham Common for our end of ride cafe stop at the Bandstand Cafe.

This ride is all on tarmac, and mostly flat other than a short climb back up to Clapham Common at the end, so suitable for all types of bikes, including Boris bikes.
Be prepared for wintry and/or wet weather e.g. thermals, warm gloves and socks, and a waterproof jacket.

We'll look forward to seeing you there!

Judith and Victoria

data.name: The Base Layer
data.description: The Base Layer This ride is the core of the original Sky led ride called the Cannon Hill Extreme but omits some of the climbs. It is a good ride to complete if you either wish to build on your start out in cycling, return to it after a period off the bike or just to ride at a steady pace with friendly group of riders. Leaving the park by the gate on Russell Road, the route travels up past Kings Heath park and then through Walkers Heath to Primrose Hill where we enter the country lanes towards Forhill. The roads sweep along finally reaching Branson's Cross roundabout before heading through Tanworth with the ‘climb’ of Tom Hill – momentum should help you over but the effort should help you build up recovery strengths. Passing through Earlswood Lakes, you will be back before you know it where you can relax and recharge at the café in the park, the usual meeting place of Cannon Hill C.C. Come and try it. The GPX will be available via our club Facebook page - https://www.facebook.com/groups/cannonhillinextremis/

data.name: Whinlatter Whoosh
data.description: This is the ride for you if you would like to give mountain biking a go or are new to mountain biking and would like to ride at one of the Lake District trail centres.  Ride in a women only group round the Blue Route at Whinlatter.  We will be riding at the pace of the slowest rider so we don't leave anyone behind.  It will be the ideal opportunity for you to increase your confidence on trails.  Afterwards we can reward ourselves with cake in the cafe.Mountain bikes are essential for this ride and so is a helmet.  You will also need to come dressed for the weather and a drink and a snack are also a good idea.  It would also be good to carry a spare inner tube, just in case you need it.  As the route can be wet and muddy, a spare change of clothing for after the ride is also advisable.  Approx 4.5 miles.Mountain biking is great fun and a good way to get fit so come along and give it a go.If you have any questions about this ride then you can e-mail us at breezenetworkeden@gmail.comor see our Facebook page for more information; Breeze Network Eden. Look forward to welcoming you on our rides.
data.beta:formattedDescription:
This is the ride for you if you would like to give mountain biking a go or are new to mountain biking and would like to ride at one of the Lake District trail centres. Ride in a women only group round the Blue Route at Whinlatter. We will be riding at the pace of the slowest rider so we don't leave anyone behind. It will be the ideal opportunity for you to increase your confidence on trails. Afterwards we can reward ourselves with cake in the cafe.


Mountain bikes are essential for this ride and so is a helmet. You will also need to come dressed for the weather and a drink and a snack are also a good idea. It would also be good to carry a spare inner tube, just in case you need it. As the route can be wet and muddy, a spare change of clothing for after the ride is also advisable. Approx 4.5 miles.


Mountain biking is great fun and a good way to get fit so come along and give it a go.


If you have any questions about this ride then you can e-mail us at breezenetworkeden@gmail.comor see our Facebook page for more information; Breeze Network Eden.

Look forward to welcoming you on our rides.

data.name: Newton Abbot Breeze Ride for Beginners
data.description: We are offering a Breeze ride for ladies that are new to cycling or haven't been on a bike for years. It's hassle free and fun! you don't even need to own your own bike. this ride is open to all ages and is for Beginners or ladies that are looking for support to get back on a bike after many years. We will provide the bikes, helmets, high viz jackets, helmets and a qualified Breeze Champion to support you in your steps to a healthier and more active lifestyle - whilst having fun with other ladies from the local area. There is a small charge to the Bike Shop for the hire of the bikes of just £4.00 per ride, payable when you arrive. Places are limited and you must book via let's ride.co.uk

data.meetingPoint: Pro Cycle Centre Bike Shop, Wharf Road, Newton Abbot TQ12 2DA Tel: 01626 438353 free parking available and coffee is available at the bike shop / lodge indoor skatepark after the ride.

data.name: Newton Abbot Breeze Ride for Beginners
data.description: We are offering a Breeze ride for ladies that are new to cycling or haven't been on a bike for years. It's hassle free and fun! you don't even need to own your own bike. this ride is open to all ages and is for Beginners or ladies that are looking for support to get back on a bike after many years. We will provide the bikes, helmets, high viz jackets, helmets and a qualified Breeze Champion to support you in your steps to a healthier and more active lifestyle - whilst having fun with other ladies from the local area. There is a small charge to the Bike Shop for the hire of the bikes of just £4.00 per ride, payable when you arrive. Places are limited and you must book via let's ride.co.uk

data.description: We are offering a Breeze ride for ladies that are new to cycling or haven't been on a bike for years. It's hassle free and fun! you don't even need to own your own bike. this ride is open to all ages and is for Beginners or ladies that are looking for support to get back on a bike after many years. We will provide the bikes, helmets, high viz jackets, helmets and a qualified Breeze Champion to support you in your steps to a healthier and more active lifestyle - whilst having fun with other ladies from the local area. There is a small charge to the Bike Shop for the hire of the bikes of just £4.00 per ride, payable when you arrive. Places are limited and you must book via let's ride.co.uk
